PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BOLINGER SEGARS GILBERT AND MOSS LLP

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK AND FAMILY

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WORKING IN CREATIVE COLLABORATION TO PROVIDE QUALITY CARE THAT TRANSFORMS THE LIVES OF AT-RISK CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH THE ACTIVE COMPASSION OF CHRIST.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WORKING IN CREATIVE COLLABORATION TO PROVIDE QUALITY CARE THAT TRANSFORMS THE LIVES OF AT-RISK CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH THE ACTIVE COMPASSION OF CHRIST.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE SHELTER AND CARE AS WELL AS MEET THE EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF ORPHANS AND DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR END OF 1/31/2022 WE HAD AN AVERAGE OF 100 BOYS AND GIRLS IN CARE IN THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD BY THE CHILDREN'S HOME FOUNDATION, A TYPE III SUPPORTING ORGANZIATION. ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK.

THE CHILDREN'S HOME ACCOUNTS FOR INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH INCOME TAX ACCOUNTING GUIDANCE IN FASB ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES. THE PRIMARY TAX POSITION OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME IS ITS FILING STATUS AS A TAX EXEMPT ENTITY. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS REFLECTED IN THE CHILDREN'S HOME TAX FILINGS AND DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS EXIST.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED DIRECTLY AGAINST FUNDRAISING INCOME 48,923.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES REPORTED DIRECTLY AGAINST FUNDRAISING INCOME 48,923. EMPLOYEE RETENTION CREDIT (ERC) 1,068,505.

$48,000 OF MR. MOORE'S BASE COMPENSATION IS PAID VIA A HOUSING ALLOWANCE EXEMPT FROM GROSS INCOME UNDER IRC SEC. 107. THE PARSONAGE ALLOWANCE IS A VERY COMMON WAY FOR CHURCHES AND OTHER RELIGIOUS ORGANIZATIONS TO PAY MINISTERS. THE PARSONAGE ALLOWANCE DOES NOT SHOW UP IN HIS W-2 BOX 5 WAGES, BUT IS INCLUDED AS BASE COMPENSATION ON THE 990.

CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK AND FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY, INC. , DBA THE CHILDREN'S HOME OF LUBBOCK IS FILING AN AMENDED 2021 FORM 990 TO CORRECTLY REPORT THE EMPLOYEE RETENTION TAX CREDIT IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,068,585 ON THE RETURN UNDER CODE SECTION 280C(A). PER GUIDANCE FROM CODE SECTION 280C(A) WE HAVE REDUCED WAGES ON PAGE 10, LINE 7 BY $1,068,585 TO REPORT THE ERC PROCEEDS RECEIVED. AN AMENDED FEDERAL RETURN IS REQUIRED TO BE FILED FOR THE TAXABLE YEAR IN WHICH THE QUALIFIED WAGES WERE PAID OR INCURRED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD DID NOT REVIEW THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING, BUT WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 AT THEIR NEXT SCHEDULED MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY AT THE JANUARY BOARD MEETING EACH DIRECTOR AND OFFICER OF THE CHILDREN'S HOME IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS USE A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE AND A MARKET ANALYSIS FROM CHILD WELFARE LEAGUE OF AMERICA WHEN DETERMINING THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION. THE BOARD AND PRESIDENT USE THE MARKET ANALYSIS FROM CHILD WELFARE LEAGUE OF AMERICA WHEN DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION OF EMPLOYEE OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING BY THE PUBLIC AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE IN LUBBOCK, TX.

INCLUDED ON LINE 1E IS $850,000 FROM THE PAYCHECK PROGRAM (PPP) LOAN DURING THE YEAR ENDING 1/31/22. THE ORGANIZATION FILED FOR FORGIVENESS AND THIS WAS APPROVED. AS SUCH, PER FASB-AS 958-605 NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES REVENUE RECOGNITION, $850,000 IS BEING RECOGNIZED AS CONTRIBUTION INCOME.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAVE ASSIGNED MEMBERS TO AN AUDIT COMMITTEE TO OVERSEE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT AND SELECT THE INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITOR.
